author: Cole8
title: Pro and Cons of ATV Arrest
review:
So this is the first set I had in lego. So here are pro and cons of this small lego box

Pros

1.) For those who have a small budget this is a perfect set.

2.) Easy for young children

Cons

1.) Very small set

2.) Building only takes around 10 minutes.

author: BlueGalaxy47
title: Nice Beginner Set
review:
The main ATV build is nice, but is very simple and uses few pieces.

I like the big wheels, which add to the aggressive style it was going for.

The clips add more detail to the ATV and is used apropriately.

The safe is nice and the stickers make it look even better.

Overall, this is a small nice set that is suited for a small city!

The only thing that could be done better is to make more space for the crook on the ATV.

author: redbeardlegoman
title: The Eternal Battle Between Good and Evil With 4x4s
review:
If I may, a pet peeve of mine is the whining of AFOLs.  In particular, the "how many police sets is TLG going to make?!"  While it is true that if you are an adult collector with a disposable income who simply has to buy every City police set, then yes, your fair burg is going to start looking like a Police State.

But I always want to look at it from the perspective of the kids coming after me.  Police sets are automatically playable.  For the young girls and boys just coming out of their Duplo days, there are always going to be several police sets released this year for them.  It won't be the same sets year after year, but they will be there.

TLG does a lot, increasingly so, every year to cater to us AFOLs (a not-to-be-ignored proportion of their customer base).  But they also have to look towards the KFOLs today who will be AFOLs tomorrow.

So you can always do what I am generally doing now.  Ask yourself not how many sets will they release, but rather how many sets do you actually need.  I used to click every City police set box for "want", even before Brickset would have a picture up.  Now, I wait for the pictures, and decide then.

This was one of the sets that didn't make the cut.  I figured I already had a few police ATVs already.  I can think of five that are specifically ATV sets (60065, 30228, 60006, 30013, and 5625) and about another five larger sets that have them.

I wouldn't say that any of them were superior to any other.  So, I wasn't rushing out the door to get this one.

However, I saw it on clearance today, and used some store credit at the local grocer's to pick it up for free.

I'm going to say that I'm ultimately glad that I did for a few reasons.  I like the light blue police shirt.  I don't already have a shirt like this, as I've been a bit more selective of my police purchases lately.  I always welcome variety.  Likewise, I don't have the crook with the brown overalls, either.  I think even his face is new to my collection.  And again, variety is prized in my ever-expanding City.

The safe is also cute, with a good sticker.  Another furniture dolly is no bad thing to have.  And the gold bars are also nice.

Basically, this is a decent set, and will no doubt be the first set for many future Lego Maniacs.  You can pass on it, as I had pretty much done, and not really suffer for the loss.  Or you can take a chance, and have another perfectly good set.
